byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER, PATRICK McGEEHAN and MIKE McPHATE
byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Chester, Pa., and Patrick McGeehan and Mike McPhate from New York. Ron Nixon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The train, headed to Savannah, Ga., from New York City, partially derailed when it crashed into a railroad backhoe, killing two Amtrak workers who were not on board.

headline.print_headline: Amtrak Train Slams Into Backhoe Near Philadelphia, Killing Two
headline.main: Amtrak Train Crash Leaves 2 Dead, Officials Say

snippet: The train, headed to Savannah, Ga., from New York City, partially derailed when it crashed into a railroad backhoe, killing two Amtrak workers who were not on board.
abstract: Amtrak train bound for Savannah, Ga, crashes outside Philadelphia, killing two track workers after colliding with backhoe left on track; eyewitnesses and passengers, 30 of whom sustained injuries, describe scene as frighteningly chaotic.
